title: Implement fully responsive mobile-first design across entire platform

requirements.text: Implement mobile-first responsive design for Navigation component with hamburger menu that appears on screens smaller than 768px (md breakpoint). The hamburger icon should toggle a mobile menu overlay with touch-friendly spacing and all navigation items.

quotes: Make the website fully responsive so it works perfectly on mobile phones, tablets, and desktops
Ensure navigation menus convert into a mobile-friendly menu (such as a hamburger menu) on smaller screens

acceptanceCriteria: Navigation displays as horizontal bar on desktop (≥768px)
Navigation shows hamburger menu icon on mobile (<768px)
Tapping hamburger opens full-screen or overlay mobile menu
Mobile menu items have minimum 44px touch targets
Mobile menu closes when item is selected or close button is tapped

requirements.text: Make all interactive elements (buttons, links, form inputs) touch-friendly with minimum 44x44px touch targets and adequate spacing (minimum 8px) between adjacent interactive elements on mobile devices.

quotes: All buttons, links, and interactive elements must be large enough and properly spaced for easy tapping with fingers

acceptanceCriteria: All buttons have minimum 44x44px dimensions on mobile
Form inputs have minimum 44px height on mobile
Interactive elements have 8px minimum spacing between them
Touch targets do not overlap or cause mis-taps

requirements.text: Ensure HomePage/LandingPage displays responsively with properly scaled background, centered content, and readable text on all screen sizes from 320px width upward.

quotes: The homepage, genres section, browse page, book pages, upload page, and user dashboard must all display correctly on phones

acceptanceCriteria: Van Gogh background scales and positions correctly on mobile
Heading text sizes appropriately on small screens
Login button remains visible and accessible on all devices
Theme toggle is accessible on mobile
No horizontal scrolling or content overflow

requirements.text: Make PersonalizedHomePage fully responsive with stacked layout on mobile: recommendations, continue reading, recently viewed, trending sections, and mood carousels should stack vertically and display properly on screens down to 320px width.

quotes: The homepage, genres section, browse page, book pages, upload page, and user dashboard must all display correctly on phones

acceptanceCriteria: All sections stack vertically on mobile (<768px)
Section headings remain readable and properly sized
Carousel controls are touch-friendly
Book cards display in appropriate grid (1 column on mobile)
No content is cut off or requires horizontal scrolling

requirements.text: Make BrowseBooksPage responsive with mobile-optimized genre/author filter dropdowns, mood chips that wrap on small screens, and a book grid that displays 1 column on mobile (<640px), 2 columns on tablets (640-1024px), and 3+ columns on desktop.

quotes: The homepage, genres section, browse page, book pages, upload page, and user dashboard must all display correctly on phones

acceptanceCriteria: Filter dropdowns are touch-friendly on mobile
Mood filter chips wrap to multiple lines on narrow screens
Book grid uses 1 column layout on screens <640px
Book grid uses 2 columns on tablets (640-1024px)
Book grid uses 3+ columns on desktop (≥1024px)
All book covers scale proportionally

requirements.text: Make BookDetailPage fully responsive with stacked layout on mobile: book cover, title, author, rating, description, and PDF viewer should stack vertically. PDF viewer should resize to fit mobile screen width while maintaining usability.

quotes: The homepage, genres section, browse page, book pages, upload page, and user dashboard must all display correctly on phones
Make sure PDF reading, login, upload, bookmarks, and all features work correctly on phones

acceptanceCriteria: Book details stack vertically on mobile
Book cover scales to fit screen without distortion
PDF viewer displays at appropriate size for mobile reading
Action buttons (bookmark, download, rate) are touch-friendly
Star rating component works with touch input
Reviews section displays properly on mobile

requirements.text: Make UploadBookPage responsive with single-column form layout on mobile, touch-friendly file upload areas, and properly sized input fields. BookForm dialog should adapt to mobile screen sizes.

quotes: The homepage, genres section, browse page, book pages, upload page, and user dashboard must all display correctly on phones

acceptanceCriteria: Form fields stack vertically on mobile
File upload dropzones are touch-friendly and large enough
All input fields have minimum 44px height on mobile
BookForm dialog fits mobile screen without overflow
Submit and cancel buttons are easily tappable

requirements.text: Make ProfilePage and AuthorDashboardPage responsive with stacked layouts on mobile. Dashboard tabs should scroll horizontally or convert to dropdown on small screens. Statistics cards should display in 1-2 column grid on mobile.

quotes: The homepage, genres section, browse page, book pages, upload page, and user dashboard must all display correctly on phones

acceptanceCriteria: Profile information displays clearly on mobile
Statistics cards use 1 column on mobile (<640px)
Dashboard tabs remain accessible on mobile (scroll or dropdown)
Edit profile button is touch-friendly
Bookmarked books grid adapts to mobile (1 column)
Delete account button remains accessible but not accidentally tappable

requirements.text: Make AdminPage and AdminReviewPage responsive with stacked book cards or list view on mobile, touch-friendly action buttons, and accessible dialogs that fit mobile screens.

quotes: The homepage, genres section, browse page, book pages, upload page, and user dashboard must all display correctly on phones

acceptanceCriteria: Book list displays in single column on mobile
Approve/reject/edit/delete buttons are touch-friendly
Confirmation dialogs fit mobile screen without scrolling
Status badges remain visible and readable
Filter controls are accessible on mobile

requirements.text: Optimize all carousel components (BookCarousel, MoodCarousel) for touch gestures with swipe support, properly sized navigation arrows for mobile, and smooth horizontal scrolling.

quotes: Optimize scrolling so it is smooth and natural on mobile devices

acceptanceCriteria: Carousels support touch swipe gestures on mobile
Navigation arrows are touch-friendly (minimum 44x44px)
Scrolling is smooth without lag
Books don't cut off at screen edges
Carousel indicators work on touch devices

requirements.text: Ensure all text content uses responsive font sizes: headings should scale down appropriately on mobile while remaining readable (minimum 16px for body text, 20px for h3, 24px for h2, 32px for h1 on mobile).

quotes: Ensure text, images, book covers, and all content scale properly and remain clear and readable on small screens

acceptanceCriteria: Body text is minimum 16px on all devices
Heading sizes scale appropriately with breakpoints
Text does not overflow containers on small screens
Line height and spacing maintain readability on mobile
No text is cut off or requires horizontal scrolling

requirements.text: Ensure all images (book covers, backgrounds, author avatars) use responsive sizing with proper aspect ratios, CSS object-fit properties, and loading states. Images should never distort or break layout on any screen size.

quotes: Ensure text, images, book covers, and all content scale properly and remain clear and readable on small screens

acceptanceCriteria: Book covers maintain aspect ratio on all devices
Images use object-fit: cover or contain appropriately
Loading skeletons match final image dimensions
No images cause horizontal overflow
Images are optimized for mobile bandwidth

requirements.text: Make Sidebar component responsive: show full sidebar on desktop (≥1024px), auto-collapse on tablets (768-1024px), and hide completely on mobile (<768px) with functionality moved to Navigation hamburger menu.

quotes: Ensure navigation menus convert into a mobile-friendly menu (such as a hamburger menu) on smaller screens

acceptanceCriteria: Sidebar visible and toggleable on desktop (≥1024px)
Sidebar auto-collapses or hides on tablets (768-1024px)
Sidebar hidden on mobile (<768px)
Sidebar navigation items appear in mobile hamburger menu
Layout adjusts smoothly when sidebar state changes

requirements.text: Ensure all modal dialogs (BookForm, EditProfileDialog, DeleteAccountModal, AuthPrompt, ProfileSetupModal, etc.) are responsive and fit mobile screens with appropriate padding, scrollable content when needed, and touch-friendly close buttons.

quotes: The layout should automatically adjust to different screen sizes and phone dimensions without breaking or overlapping

acceptanceCriteria: Modals fit within mobile viewport without overflow
Modal content scrolls if it exceeds screen height
Close buttons are touch-friendly (minimum 44x44px)
Form inputs in modals are properly sized for mobile
Modal backdrop prevents scrolling of background content

requirements.text: Verify and test that all existing features (bookmarking, rating, progress tracking, authentication, file uploads) function correctly on mobile devices with touch input and mobile browsers.

quotes: Make sure PDF reading, login, upload, bookmarks, and all features work correctly on phones

acceptanceCriteria: Internet Identity login works on mobile browsers
Star rating accepts touch input
Bookmark toggle works with tap gestures
File upload works on mobile (camera and file system)
PDF viewer displays and navigates on mobile
All form submissions work on mobile devices

requirements.text: Add responsive breakpoints to Tailwind config and update all components to use responsive utility classes (sm:, md:, lg:, xl:) for layout, spacing, typography, and visibility following mobile-first approach.
acceptanceCriteria: All components use mobile-first CSS (base styles for mobile)
Breakpoints applied progressively: sm (640px), md (768px), lg (1024px), xl (1280px)
No desktop-first styles that break on mobile
Responsive utilities used consistently across codebase
Layout classes follow mobile → tablet → desktop progression

requirements.text: Maintain consistent Van Gogh-inspired color scheme (blue, gold, white), typography, spacing, and design patterns across all screen sizes to ensure visual uniformity and professional appearance on mobile, tablet, and desktop.

quotes: Maintain consistent colors, fonts, spacing, and design across mobile and desktop so the website looks uniform and professional on all devices

acceptanceCriteria: Color palette remains consistent across all breakpoints
Font families and weights consistent on all devices
Spacing scale (padding, margins) maintains proportions
Dark mode works correctly on all screen sizes
Visual hierarchy preserved across responsive layouts

constraints: All responsive changes must be frontend-only; do not modify backend/main.mo or backend/migration.mo
Do not edit frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, useInternetIdentity.tsx, useActor.ts, or main.tsx
Do not edit any files in frontend/src/components/ui directory
Maintain existing Van Gogh theming and color scheme defined in index.css
Preserve existing Internet Identity authentication flow
Do not break existing functionality while adding responsive features
nonGoals: Adding new features beyond responsive design improvements
Changing the technology stack or framework
Modifying backend data models or API endpoints
Redesigning the Van Gogh-inspired theme or color palette
Implementing native mobile apps (React Native, Flutter, etc.)
Adding animations or transitions beyond smooth scrolling
Changing authentication method from Internet Identity
